greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k>=1} 1/(2^k - 3).
comment: Erdős and Graham (1980) asked whether this constant is irrational, and Borwein (1991) proved that it is indeed irrational.
reference: Paul Erdős, Some of my favourite unsolved problems, in A. Baker, B. Bollobás and A. Hajnal (eds.), A tribute to Paul Erdős, Cambridge University Press, 1990, p. 470.
link: Peter B. Borwein, On the irrationality of Sigma (1/(q^n + r)), Journal of Number Theory, Vol. 37, No. 3 (1991), pp. 253-259.
Paul Erdős and Ronald L. Graham, Old and new problems and results in combinatorial number theory, L'enseignement Mathématique, Université de Genève, 1980, p. 62.
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, May 03 2020
